text:
Does anyone know about this new feature and how to disable it? I don't see "control audience access" in my blog settings but my blog subscription has by default now "weekly/monthly" radio button selection that i don't want
<https://www.HubSpot.com/product-updates/restrict-blog-access-with-cms-memberships>
Question is it the default for HS Forms now to load inside an iframe and use one of the default themes.
I believe it’s only for free and start portals, but if you are seeing something different let me knwo

I’m seeing it on a portal that atleast has the CMS addon not sure their plan details. we had a form embedded inside a rich text field in their site using the JS embed (wasn’t me, was a marketer that did it)
and the form was getting embedded as an iframe, I found the “unstyle” option and that did the trick. I do think the unstyle toggle is in the wrong place though
should be on that styling tab so you can find it easier. I only found it through determination, knowing it existed somewhere
the designer is Dublin so I won’t expect any response, but I’ll pass that along to her now

Any details <@U2677TWJ2>? Stioll running into issues?

Side Note - <#C2YGWHDKQ|marketplace> is a great place to ask marketplace-specific questions :slightly_smiling_face:
Just reposted this in <#CD5RBLPBL|cms-membership> to see if the folks in there can give some thoughts.
Let me ask around and see if I can get an ideas.
This should be happening. We’ll take a look. The known exception cases are when pages have inline CSS or we notice visual differences in a page when the CSS is combined.
Example URLs are helpful for us to test out
We are working on something that will give you more insight on why they are not minified or combined.
<@U79N5J2AU> just so I’m clear - you don’t want CMS memberships, but you believe your default blog settings have changed?
